participant_1.background:
I've never been to a fortune teller, but I'm not really interested in knowing my future.
I had to sell my motorcycle to pay for my car.
I was a technical support engineer at a small startup before I got my current job.
i have a career in party planning.
I'm proud of my work ethic and dedication to my craft.

participant_2.background:
I drive a van because it's spacious and I can take my friends along to watch Scooby Doo at the drive-in theater.
i am a doctor.
My pets are a great way to teach my kids about responsibility and compassion.
i have a vacation home in the mountains.
I'm a young adult who doesn't want my parents to know about my deployment.

content.text: Hi there!
Hello!
What do you do for work?
I'm a doctor. What about you?
I'm a party planner. It's a lot of work, but I love it.
I can imagine! I used to work as a technical support engineer at a small startup. It was a lot of work, but it was also really rewarding.
What made you want to switch to medicine?
I've always wanted to be a doctor. I'm passionate about helping people, and I think medicine is the best way to do that.
That's awesome! What's your favorite part about being a doctor?
I love getting to know my patients and helping them get better. It's really rewarding to see the difference you can make in someone's life.
I can imagine! I love seeing the smiles on my clients' faces when they're having a great time at their party.
That's awesome! It's so important to have a job that you love.
I agree! It makes all the difference in the world.
So, what are some of your favorite things to do outside of work?
I love spending time with my friends and family, going to concerts, and traveling.
Me too! I love going to concerts and traveling. I also love spending time with my family and friends.
It sounds like we have a lot in common!
Yeah, it does! It's nice to meet someone who shares my interests.
Me too! It's been a pleasure chatting with you.
You too! Have a great day!
You too!
